abstracts.cdata!:
This results profile talks about the
            Solid Waste and Environmental Management Project in West
            Bank and Gaza. Drawing on World Bank Group financing and
            expertise since 2001, the Palestinians were able to improve
            solid waste management and environmental conditions in 80
            communities in Jenin Governorate, with a population of
            200,000 people. They achieved this by establishing a new
            sanitary landfill, closing and rehabilitating 85 dumpsites,
            and improving waste collection services. Towards the end of
            the project, the new landfill was expanded to serve all five
            governors that comprises the northern West Bank (population
            600,000), providing for further cost saving and enhancing
            public-private partnerships.
